author: trent_vanepps
content:
I should have mentioned this a few weeks ago when I thought of it but I think the members of this discord should be much more conservative about where the public invite links are shared. It's going to become unmanageable pretty fast. 

I would not share invite links on twitter, or reddit for that matter, only in DMs for people who are genuinely interested in discussion or observing. Otherwise this becomes a helpdesk or people asking "when phase 0???" "When EIP 1559???"

The alternative is to more rigorously enforce off-topic bans.

author: timbeiko
content: Yeah I think it's a fine line: you don't want people to feel like things are happening "behind closed doors", but at the same time you don't want spam either. I'd be happy to more rigorously enforce off-topic bans. Can people be blocked from specific channels?

author: timbeiko
content: I feel like especially since 1559 got a large community grant there's a sort of duty to keep things open, but there is a point where it becomes counterproductive üòÖ
